intro: Magadania victoris, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in forested areas at high elevations. The leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture.
